meanings.sent1: The creaks of the old wooden floor echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: I heard the creaks of the rusty gate as it swung open.
meanings.sent3: The creaks of the chair made it sound like it was singing a song.
meanings.sent4: The creaks of the ship's hull warned of impending danger.
meanings.sent5: The creaks of the door at night always gave me chills.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: When I walk, my shoes creak on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent2: The old staircase creaks with every step I take.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing set creaks in protest as I push it higher.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches creak against the window.
meanings.sent5: The door creaks open slowly, revealing a dark room.

meanings.definition: A noise made by something old or in poor condition
meanings.sent1: The creaks of the dilapidated house could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The creaks of the broken wheelbarrow filled the quiet garden.
meanings.sent3: The creaks of the ancient piano added character to the music.
meanings.sent4: The creaks of the worn-out floorboards signaled years of use.
meanings.sent5: The creaks of the weathered sign swayed in the wind.
